means: （指记忆力）有记性的，记性强的
能保持或容纳液体等的

sentence.Network_en: Luke had an amazingly retentive memory.
He is a scholar who has wide learning and a retentive memory.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是一位博闻强记的学者.

sentence.Network_en: He has a very retentive memory.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French retentif, -ive or medieval Latin retentivus, from retent- 'held back', from the verb retinere (see retain)

entry.def: If you have a retentive memory, you are able to remember things very well.

example.ex: Luke had an amazingly retentive memory.

auth_sentence.content: Mulch the roots with organic matter to keep the soil weed-free and moisture-retentive.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mulch the roots with organic matter to keep the soil weed-free and moisture-retentive.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mulch the roots with organic matter to keep the soil weed-free and moisture-retentive.

auth_sentence.content: Jay has an anomalous memory, extraordinarily retentive but riddled with hard-to-account-for gaps.
auth_sentence.res_content: Jay has an anomalous memory, extraordinarily retentive but riddled with hard-to-account-for gaps.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Jay has an anomalous memory, extraordinarily retentive but riddled with hard-to-account-for gaps.

auth_sentence.content: These require fertile, moisture retentive soil and will not enjoy the drier summers.
auth_sentence.res_content: These require fertile, moisture retentive soil and will not enjoy the drier summers.
